channel.title: The Green Thumb Podcast
channel.description: The Blog of The Arbor Gate
channel.itunes:summary: The Green Thumb Podcast is a resource for gardeners all across the gulf coast region. A new expert guest every week will share their knowledge and stories, and answer listener questions. Recorded at The Arbor Gate in Tomball, Texas. Find out more and ask your questions at www.arborgate.com.
channel.itunes:author: The Green Thumb Podcast
channel.itunes:subtitle: The Arbor Gate

item.title: Podcast Episode 18: DIY Network’s “Yard Crashers” and the Lucky Homeowner
item.dc:creator: The Arbor Gate
item.description: Last September we were thrilled to host Matt Blashaw and DIY Network’s Yard Crashers. It was such an exciting time around here and now we are gearing up for the episode to air nationally. On this episode of the Green Thumb Podcast we finally sat down with the lucky homeowner who won the crash of a […]
item.content:encoded:
Last September we were thrilled to host Matt Blashaw and DIY Network’s Yard Crashers. It was such an exciting time around here and now we are gearing up for the episode to air nationally. On this episode of the Green Thumb Podcast we finally sat down with the lucky homeowner who won the crash of a lifetime. We were thrilled to provide all the beautiful plants for her yard— but we didn’t leave her hanging.  Listen as Beverly answers all her follow up questions on the care and maintenance of the plants.  Catch the Arbor Gate on two episodes of Yard Crashers on the DIY Network on Monday July 28th. Also, come out to watch the episode on a huge outdoor screen at our Purple Carpet event on Saturday August 2!

 

We hope you’re enjoying the podcast. Don’t forget that you can subscribe on iTunes.

item.itunes:summary:
Last September we were thrilled to host Matt Blashaw and DIY Network’s Yard Crashers. It was such an exciting time around here and now we are gearing up for the episode to air nationally. On this episode of the Green Thumb Podcast we finally sat down with the lucky homeowner who won the crash of a lifetime. We were thrilled to provide all the beautiful plants for her yard— but we didn’t leave her hanging. Listen as Beverly answers all her follow up questions on the care and maintenance of the plants. Catch the Arbor Gate on two episodes of Yard Crashers on the DIY Network on Monday July 28th. Also, come out to watch the episode on a huge outdoor screen at our Purple Carpet event on Saturday August 2!
We hope you're enjoying the podcast. Don't forget that you can subscribe on iTunes.

item.title: Green Thumb Podcast Episode 17: A Natural Beauty with Linda Gay
item.dc:creator: The Arbor Gate
item.description: We have waited for this wonderful rain, but with it come droves of biting mosquitos. So how do we exist happily and naturally outside in the garden? We look for ways to reduce the population of mosquitos living in our garden by following a few simple steps: 1.) Turn off the irrigation system! The ground […]
item.content:encoded:
We have waited for this wonderful rain, but with it come droves of biting mosquitos. So how do we exist happily and naturally outside in the garden?  We look for ways to reduce the population of mosquitos living in our garden by following a few simple steps:

1.) Turn off the irrigation system! The ground is saturated and now needs to dry out and this is the perfect time to save you some money! Take advantage of the tropical moisture we are receiving, we are under the influence of El Nino again.

2.) Mow your grass two times a week as the grass is responding with rapid vegetative growth produced by the rain. (Mowing is also a great physical workout!) Reducing the height of the grass allows the sun to dry out the soil to prevent root rot of grass and plants.

3.) Tree and shrub pruning becomes obvious during rains, you need to remove branches that are weighted down and dragging the ground or overhanging the walks and driveway. If you have a shady area, now is a good time to remove the lower branches on the trees and prune down tall shrubs to allow sunlight and air circulation in shady areas. Shade is where mosquitos love to live, so we need to make the area undesirable for them by bringing in air circulation, wind and sunlight.

Now we have implemented treatments to reduce mosquito population in the yard, what can we do for our self to enjoy the outdoors again, searching for a natural insect repellent?

I first learned about American Beautyberry, Callicarpa americana, as a mosquito repellent during my visit to Brookhaven, Mississippi.  We were walking through the woods and I started to feel the bite of mosquitos and commented, “I should have sprayed with Deet before walking through the woods.”  Jim Bonner, owner of Bamboo Plantation, grabbed a branch of Beautyberry, and stripped the leaves off and handed them to me and said, “Crush and rub these leaves on you”, they act as a mosquito repellant.  I did and it worked!

Talking with another friend who worked for a nursery in the National Forest, commented, “We never had mosquitos at the nursery,” because the Beautyberry was growing wild in the pine forest next door.  So I think it is definitely worth the effort to strategically plant Beautyberry around dog kennels, livestock areas, and outdoor sitting areas, it can repel mosquitos just growing and also be close enough to grab a handful to crush and rub on the body.

This traditional folk remedy has been used by people in the Mississippi Hill Country for over a century. They cut branches, with the leaves still on them, crush the leaves and stick the branches between the harness and the horse to repel mosquitos, horseflies, and deerflies.  This folk remedy did not go unnoticed by the University of Mississippi.

This natural repellent was confirmed in 2006, by the USDA Research Service housed at the National Center for Natural Products Research at the University of Mississippi, Three organic compounds have been isolated from the Callicarpa plant; callicarpenal, intermedeol, and spathulenol. The plant is producing these chemicals for a reason, but what is it, prevent an insect attack on itself?  www.olemiss.edu/depts/pharmacy/ncnpr

 

Photo Credit: Lady Bird Johnson Wildflower Center Library
Sally and Andy Wasowski

Callicarpa americana, known as American beautyberry or French Mulberry, is a native, deciduous shrub that grows 4-6’ tall and as wide, has large leaves and produces flowers followed by clusters of purple berries in late summer or fall in the south. It is found growing naturally in sunny areas of woodland forests and the purple fruit is eaten by armadillos, raccoons and possums. Growing in a variety of soils, this drought tolerant “beauty” is a must for every garden. Originally planted for its’ ornamental value and toughness, the Beautyberry moves up to the top of our list as the Beauty that stopped the Beast!

Plant three today!

Linda Gay
June 29, 2014

item.title: Green Thumb Podcast Episode 16: Edible Landscaping with Angela Chandler
item.dc:creator: The Arbor Gate
item.description: Gardeners that stop by the Arbor Gate frequently want to know how to add more edibles to their garden. With more and more products in the grocery store coming from overseas, it’s great to know that your food is truly organic and to know exactly where it came from- your garden! This week on the […]
item.content:encoded:
Gardeners that stop by the Arbor Gate frequently want to know how to add more edibles to their garden. With more and more products in the grocery store coming from overseas, it’s great to know that your food is truly organic and to know exactly where it came from- your garden! This week on the podcast we have Angela Chandler of thegardenacademy.com to discuss the ins and outs of growing edibles right from your own garden.

Don’t forget, we want to hear from you! Leave us your questions and comments. You can also subscribe and leave reviews on iTunes using the link below.

Don't forget, we want to hear from you! Leave us your questions and comments. You can also subscribe and leave reviews on iTunes using the link below.

item.title: Green Thumb Podcast Episode 15: Chilli Thrips with Gaye Hammond
item.dc:creator: The Arbor Gate
item.description: This week on the podcast we’re joined by Gaye Hammond to talk about a relatively new species of garden pest that can wreak havoc if uncontrolled. We’re talking about the Chilli Thrip: What they eat, What they look like, How to correctly diagnose them, and most importantly, how to control them. Gaye has also provided us […]
item.content:encoded:
This week on the podcast we’re joined by Gaye Hammond to talk about a relatively new species of garden pest that can wreak havoc if uncontrolled. We’re talking about the Chilli Thrip: What they eat, What they look like, How to correctly diagnose them, and most importantly, how to control them. Gaye has also provided us with a visual guide to help diagnose this problem. It is available by visiting this blog post.

We hope you’re enjoying the podcast. Don’t forget that you can subscribe on iTunes.
item.itunes:keywords: Chilli Thrips,Garden Pests,Gaye Hammond,Green Thumb Podcast

item.title: Green Thumb Podcast Episode 14: Feng Shui with Katherine Ashby
item.dc:creator: The Arbor Gate
item.description: Feng Shui literally means “Wind Water”- two things that are essential for gardens! Our guest on The Green Thumb Podcast this week is Katherine Ashby of Feng Shui Houston and she is here to talk about how the colors, shapes, and movement of your garden effect the energy of your home. Don’t forget that you […]
item.content:encoded:
Feng Shui literally means “Wind Water”- two things that are essential for gardens! Our guest on The Green Thumb Podcast this week is Katherine Ashby of Feng Shui Houston and she is here to talk about how the colors, shapes, and movement of your garden effect the energy of your home.

Don’t forget that you can subscribe on iTunes and feel free to leave a review and let other gardeners know what you think!

Don't forget that you can subscribe on iTunes and feel free to leave a review and let other gardeners know what you think!

item.title: Green Thumb Podcast Episode 13: Butterflies with Dr. Nancy Greig
item.dc:creator: The Arbor Gate
item.description: Beneficial insects are great for any garden, and there is none more lovely than the butterfly. If you want to know how you can optimize your garden to attract beautiful butterflies and caterpillars then this is the podcast for you! Dr. Nancy Greig, Ph.D. is our guest. Dr. Greig is the Director of the Cockrell […]
item.content:encoded:
Beneficial insects are great for any garden, and there is none more lovely than the butterfly. If you want to know how you can optimize your garden to attract beautiful butterflies and caterpillars then this is the podcast for you! Dr. Nancy Greig, Ph.D. is our guest. Dr. Greig is the Director of the Cockrell Butterfly Center in Houston, TX.

If you are enjoying our podcast, please consider jumping over to iTunes and giving us a rating. Also, don’t forget to submit your questions!
item.itunes:keywords: butterflies,Cockrell Butterfly Center,Green Thumb Podcast,Nancy Greig
item.itunes:subtitle: Beneficial insects are great for any garden, and there is none more lovely than the butterfly. If you want to know how you can optimize your garden to attract beautiful butterflies and caterpillars then this is the podcast for you! Dr. Nancy Greig, Ph.D.

If you want to know how you can optimize your garden to attract beautiful butterflies and caterpillars then this is the podcast for you! Dr. Nancy Greig, Ph.D. is our guest. Dr. Greig is the Director of the Cockrell Butterfly Center in Houston, TX.
If you are enjoying our podcast, please consider jumping over to iTunes and giving us a rating. Also, don't forget to submit your questions!

item.title: Green Thumb Podcast Episode 12: Heirloom Bulbs with Chris Wiesinger
item.dc:creator: The Arbor Gate
item.description: We are so glad to have our good friend on the podcast this week- The Bulb Hunter, Chris Wiesinger. Chris is the founder of the Southern Bulb Company and we always love to hear his tales of adventure as he travels around collecting rare and heirloom bulbs to share with the world. Bulbs truly are […]
item.content:encoded:
We are so glad to have our good friend on the podcast this week- The Bulb Hunter, Chris Wiesinger. Chris is the founder of the Southern Bulb Company and we always love to hear his tales of adventure as he travels around collecting rare and heirloom bulbs to share with the world. Bulbs truly are the champions of the garden, withstanding cold winters and reappearing year after year like an old friend.

If you enjoy this episode, please stop by iTunes and leave feedback and a rating. Thanks for listening!
item.itunes:keywords: Bulb Hunter,Chris Wiesinger,Heirloom Bulbs,Southern Bulb Company,The Green Thumb Podcast
item.itunes:subtitle: We are so glad to have our good friend on the podcast this week- The Bulb Hunter, Chris Wiesinger. Chris is the founder of the Southern Bulb Company and we always love to hear his tales of adventure as he travels around collecting rare and heirloom bul...
item.itunes:summary:
We are so glad to have our good friend on the podcast this week- The Bulb Hunter, Chris Wiesinger. Chris is the founder of the Southern Bulb Company and we always love to hear his tales of adventure as he travels around collecting rare and heirloom bulbs to share with the world. Bulbs truly are the champions of the garden, withstanding cold winters and reappearing year after year like an old friend.
If you enjoy this episode, please stop by iTunes and leave feedback and a rating. Thanks for listening!
item.itunes:author: The Green Thumb Podcast

item.title: Green Thumb Podcast Episode 11: Citrus with George Shackelford
item.dc:creator: The Arbor Gate
item.description: Cooking shows and gardening shows are becoming more and more popular these days. As a result, we get a lot of requests for edibles in the garden at The Arbor Gate. One of the easiest and most satisfying garden edibles to grow is citrus. We’re so happy to have an expert with us today on […]
item.content:encoded:
Cooking shows and gardening shows are becoming more and more popular these days. As a result, we get a lot of requests for edibles in the garden at The Arbor Gate. One of the easiest and most satisfying garden edibles to grow is citrus. We’re so happy to have an expert with us today on this subject, George Shackelford. George is the manager of the premier citrus grower in Texas, Brazos Citrus Nursery. You will enjoy his advice and insight- and the fruit from your garden!

If you enjoy the podcast, please consider leaving a review on iTunes using the button below. Thanks!
item.itunes:keywords: Brazos Citrus Nursery,Citrus,Citrus Trees,Fruit Trees,George Shackelford,Green Thumb Podcast
item.itunes:subtitle: Cooking shows and gardening shows are becoming more and more popular these days. As a result, we get a lot of requests for edibles in the garden at The Arbor Gate. One of the easiest and most satisfying garden edibles to grow is citrus.
item.itunes:summary:
Cooking shows and gardening shows are becoming more and more popular these days. As a result, we get a lot of requests for edibles in the garden at The Arbor Gate. One of the easiest and most satisfying garden edibles to grow is citrus. We're so happy to have an expert with us today on this subject, George Shackelford. George is the manager of the premier citrus grower in Texas, Brazos Citrus Nursery. You will enjoy his advice and insight- and the fruit from your garden!
If you enjoy the podcast, please consider leaving a review on iTunes using the button below. Thanks!
item.itunes:author: The Green Thumb Podcast

item.title: Green Thumb Podcast Episode 10: Heirloom Vegetables with Pam Gunter
item.dc:creator: The Arbor Gate
item.description: Who doesn’t love the idea of eating from your own garden? Vegetable gardening has been growing in popularity lately, as has sharing plants between gardeners and passing down heirlooms. No one knows more about Heirloom Vegetables than our guest this week, Pam Gunter. Gunter’s Heirloom Vegetables are the exclusive growers of heirloom vegetables for the […]
item.content:encoded:
Who doesn’t love the idea of eating from your own garden? Vegetable gardening has been growing in popularity lately, as has sharing plants between gardeners and passing down heirlooms. No one knows more about Heirloom Vegetables than our guest this week, Pam Gunter. Gunter’s Heirloom Vegetables are the exclusive growers of heirloom vegetables for the Arbor Gate- their stuff is that good. On this episode of The Green Thumb Podcast, Pam will share with you all you need to know to get started with your own heirloom vegetables.

If you are enjoying our podcast, please consider jumping over to iTunes and giving us a rating. Also, don’t forget to submit your questions!
item.itunes:keywords: Green Thumb Podcast,Gunter's Heirloom Vegetables,Heirloom Tomatoes,Heirloom Vegetables,Pam Gunter
item.itunes:subtitle: Who doesn't love the idea of eating from your own garden? Vegetable gardening has been growing in popularity lately, as has sharing plants between gardeners and passing down heirlooms. No one knows more about Heirloom Vegetables than our guest this week,

item.title: Green Thumb Podcast Episode 9: Live Q&A with Bill Adams and Tom LeRoy
item.dc:creator: The Arbor Gate
item.description: Bill Adams and Tom LeRoy are always 2 of our most popular guests at The Arbor Gate when they come to teach. We had such a great time with them recently at the vegetable gardening class. We were able to record the Question and Answer portion of that class and publish it here on our […]
item.content:encoded: Bill Adams and Tom LeRoy are always 2 of our most popular guests at The Arbor Gate when they come to teach. We had such a great time with them recently at the vegetable gardening class. We were able to record the Question and Answer portion of that class and publish it here on our podcast. You all asked questions on a wide range of topics and Tom and Bill did not disappoint. Enjoy!
item.itunes:subtitle: Bill Adams and Tom LeRoy are always 2 of our most popular guests at The Arbor Gate when they come to teach. We had such a great time with them recently at the vegetable gardening class. We were able to record the Question and Answer portion of that cla...
item.itunes:summary: Bill Adams and Tom LeRoy are always 2 of our most popular guests at The Arbor Gate when they come to teach. We had such a great time with them recently at the vegetable gardening class. We were able to record the Question and Answer portion of that class and publish it here on our podcast. You all asked questions on a wide range of topics and Tom and Bill did not disappoint. Enjoy!
